description: This course is designed to assist students in developing their own teacher style as they prepare to become full-time teachers. Topics include the roles and responsibilities of teachers, methods of instruction, planning, classroom management, assessment and reporting and other current educational issues. Through micro-teaching and school-based field experiences, they also practice instructional skills and techniques. Required 20-hour field experience. Offered each semester. Prerequisite: EDUC 290 and acceptance into the teacher education program.
name: Principles of Education, K-12
notes: Open to rising Seniors and Juniors only. Prerequisite: EDUC 290
prerequisites: Prerequisite: EDUC 290 and acceptance into the teacher education program.
